title: "Unspecified error occurred" Installation failing at 33%  (On Ubuntu and playonlinux)
body: So I recently installed Ubuntu and playonlinux because I wanted to play LoL on my chromebook, and everything was going fine until I got too 33% on the installation process and it started to say "Update failed, unspecified error occurred. Please check the logs for more information."  I tried following several other board posts but absolutely nothing worked.  I don't know if it's going to work since I am on a chromebook, but can anyone help me?

replies.body: League doesn't currently support any of the operating systems that you mentioned above, and I'm not sure that your chromebook has the power to support it even with a new OS on it.  You can check the[ recommended specs ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654-Minimum-and-Recommended-System-Requirements)to be sure.  Normally, getting stuck there suggests a connection problem.  You can try the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to troubleshoot, but to be honest it's unlikely you'll be able to play on that device.  Let me know if you have any questions!
